Package au.edu.anu.twcore.data.runtime

Class Metadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.anu.twcore.data.runtime.OutputData
      • au.edu.anu.twcore.data.runtime.Metadata
  • public class Metadata
extends OutputData

    A class to send metadata from DataTrackers to DataReceivers. Metadata are "data about the data", i.e. information that can be useful to the receiver to process the data (e.g. measurement units, label, range of values...). A DataTracker will send the metadata prior to any data message, assuming its information applies to all those it will send thereafter.

    In the general case, any data structure can be used as metadata, as long as the data receiver knows how to handle it. DataTrackers implement the Singleton<M> interface for metadata, i.e. they have a getInstance() method which will return a metadata instance of class M.

    In this implementation, we store all metadata in an ExtendablePropertyList. As a result, further properties can be added to the metadata after construction -- this to handle complex cases where metadata come from diverse origins.

    Typical use case for this class: 

     Metadata meta = myDataTracker.getInstance();
 meta.addProperties(MyAdditionalPropertyList);
 ...
 myDataTracker.sendMetadata(meta);
 ...
 myDataTracker.sendData(...);

    NOTE: although this class is a descendant of OutputData, its simulator status field is set to null, as this is meaningless for metadata.

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 10 sept. 2019

    • Constructor Detail

      • Metadata

        public Metadata​(int senderId,
                fr.cnrs.iees.properties.ReadOnlyPropertyList properties)
        Constructor for a metadata record. The receiver is supposed to know what to do with the metadata sent. The constructor works out a unique integer id linked to this instance of Metadata, which enables to match future output data records to this metadata instance. This id is accessible through the type() method.
        Parameters:
        senderId - the id of the DataTracker
        properties - all the metadata as a property list
